Comments_List:
Critical reading skills in an English department context
Writing textual analysis
Critical discussion, critical writing, close reading.
By taking Professor Brisman's course, I gradually developed a habit of annotating the context. I also became a better writer in terms of developing sophisticated analytical skills.
Overall this course is wonderful! It's a heavy workload in a short period of time, but if you stay on top of it and learn from feedback you'll get so much out of it.
This course was amazing. I loved the small class size. My only complaint is that it was so short and condensed, but that is the nature of summer session.
I really like the idea of adding the screening section to our curriculum because the students will then have the opportunity to compare different productions from each Shakespeare play.
I really recommend other students to take this course because the students will not only benefit from a perspective from English literature but also history, political science, and "quantum physics".
